metadata.Title: CVE-2012-2582 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Open Ticket RequestSystem (OTRS) Help Desk 2.4.x before 2.4.13, 3.0.x before 3.0.15, and 3.1.xbefore 3.1.9, and OTRS ITSM 2.1.x before 2.1.5, 3.0.x before 3.0.6, and3.1.x before 3.1.6, allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web scriptor HTML via an e-mail message body with (1) a Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)expression property in the STYLE attribute of an arbitrary element or (2)UTF-7 text in an HTTP-EQUIV="CONTENT-TYPE" META element.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2582` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

otrs - 3.1.7+dfsg1-4
otrs2 - 3.1.7+dfsg1-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: otrs2 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.7+dfsg1-4').
